team.name: Henry Kiritu
bio: He is the Patron of the group. He gives the pastoral direction of the group. He is also a mandatory signature on all financial transactions.
He has been very instrumental in the promotion and guidance of the group

team.name: James Makena Wanyangi
bio: He chairs all the group meetings and represents the self-help group in all stairs of the governance hierarchy.
He is an expert in governance and leadership with extensive experience in financial institutions, especially SACCOs.
He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Public Administration & Governance, a Diploma in Social Development, and a Certificate in Animal Health.
He is also an Accredited Professional Mediator and practices both court-annexed and private.

team.name: Kennedy Ngoro Mutugi
bio: He holds a Diploma in Computer Management, Service & Repair, and a Certificate in Electronics Science.
He currently operates a service business with an electronics workshop.
In the group, he chairs the Capacity Building Committee which deals with member's education and business development

team.name: Hannah Wanjiru Ng'ang'a
bio: She holds a Diploma in Clearing & Forwarding and has also done 10 Computer Packages.
As a Treasurer, she is the custodian of all group's assets both physical and financial.
She also chairs the Finance & Budget Committee.

team.name: Esther Njeri Kinyuru
bio: She holds a Diploma in Early Childhood Development.
Currently a full-time ECD Teacher.
As the secretary, she writes and documents all the group's deliberations and resolutions.
She also chairs the Risk, Audit & Compliance.

team.name: Samuel Kanini Kamau
bio: He is a CPA-K Profession.
He oversees the operations of the group including Finance, Promotion, and Customer Service.
He is also the liaison between members and the management committee.

team.name: Peter Mbugua Matiru
bio: He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Philosophy and a Certificate in Teaching.
He is the secretary of the Finance & Budget Committee as well as a member of the Risk, Audit & Compliance Committee.

team.name: Samuel Ngure Mburu
bio: He is a seasonal artisan in Building and Construction.
He is a member of the Capacity Building Committee and Finance & Budget

team.name: John Maingi Kimani
bio: He operates a tailoring business and has attended several marketing seminars and workshops.
He is a member of the Capacity Building and Risk, Audit & Compliance Committee

membership_requirements: A copy of Next of Kin National ID
Birth Certificate / Baptism Card for Minor Accounts.

loan_products.description: This an all-purpose loan granted to all members individually or corporates to finance development projects
This loan granted to members to finance emergency needs e.g sickness, natural disasters, or accidents
This loan granted to members to finance education needs e.g tuition fees, books and related expenses
This loan product designed to finance trading activities. The loan shall be advanced to ongoing businesses only
This loan is granted for agricultural purposes aimed at promoting agriculture for food security, improved livelihoods.
This loan is granted to Catholic Churches only through the Parish pastoral.

membership_products.description: This membership is granted to individuals who are 18 years and above and are willing to save and borrow from the society.
This membership is granted to organizations, companies, and institutions that are willing to save and borrow from the society.
This membership is granted to individuals who are below years and are willing to save and borrow from the society.

payment_channels.name: MPESA
payment_channels.accountNumber: Paybill No: 123 456 Account Name: Member's No
